org.openimaj.vis.timeline

Interface TimelineObject

  • All Superinterfaces:
    VisualisationImageProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AudioOverviewVisualisation, ShotBoundaryVideoBarVisualisation, TimelineObjectAdapter, VideoBarVisualisation, VideoObjectVisualisation

    public interface TimelineObject
extends VisualisationImageProvider
    An object that can be drawn into a timeline needs to be able to provide the start and end time of its data, and also be able to accept a size at which it should draw itself. The object should draw itself in the given image size with the start and end times fitting in the image exactly. This allows the Timeline visualisation to scale the object as necessary and allow it to align with the time ruler.
    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      Returns the size that this object wishes to be.
      long getStartTimeMilliseconds()
      Returns the start time of the timeline object in the timeline.

      The timeline object will need to know how to convert between time and pixels, and the DataUnitsTransformer given here should be able to do that.

      • setDataPixelTransformer

        void setDataPixelTransformer(DataUnitsTransformer<Float[],double[],int[]> dpt)
        The timeline object will need to know how to convert between time and pixels, and the DataUnitsTransformer given here should be able to do that. Use it to paint the image.
        Parameters:
        dpt -

      • getPreferredSize

        Dimension getPreferredSize()
        The timeline object needs to be able to suggest a size, if it needs a particular amount. It's not guaranteed it will get this size, but it may ask for it by implementing this method.
        Returns:
        A Dimension

      • getRequiredSize

        Dimension getRequiredSize()
        Returns the size that this object wishes to be.
        Returns:
        The size the object wishes to be.
